title: Latest search for Dezi Freeman now focused on finding his body | ABC NEWS
description: Victoria Police says a targeted search has focused on locating evidence or the body of fugitive Dezi Freeman, four months after he allegedly fatally shot two police officers in Porepunkah, in north-east Victoria. In a statement, a police spokesperson said an extensive targeted search of the Mount Buffalo National Park had been carried out in the past week as part of its ongoing investigation. description: There are five regions in Ukraine's south east Vladimir Putin wants but has not been able to win militarily. title: SA Liberal leader resigns three months before election | ABC NEWS
description: South Australia's Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia has resigned just three months out from the state election following what's been widely regarded as a poor stint as opposition leader. Chief Elections Analyst Casey Briggs says polling suggested the party could lose all but three of their seats in the lower house at the next election. title: Heatwave crushes NSW with more to come over weekend | ABC NEWS
description: A band of hot air has been blown from Australia's north-west to the east coast, with Sydney on the receiving end of its hottest day in two years. The elevated temperatures are expected to linger until Sunday before a southerly change comes through. title: Fri Fix: The Devils' lair is a lock
description: They say politics and sport don't mix but the future of the Tasmania Devils was decided in parliament this week. After much debate and a lot of late nights the Macquarie Point stadium was approved meaning the Devils can get on with business and start preparing to enter the competition in 2028. Will this vote be the end of the controversy in Tasmania or are there more twists in the Devils tale?    Featuring: Chris Rowbottom, ABC SPORT.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Inquiry lays out 2018 Novichok poisoning by Russian spies in England | ABC NEWS
description: A UK public inquiry has found Russian President Vladimir Putin morally responsible for the poisoning death of a British woman in 2018. Dawn Sturgess died from exposure to the military-grade nerve agent Novichok, after spraying herself with a scavenged perfume bottle. The deadly poison was smuggled into the UK by two Russian military intelligence agents and discarded after the attempted murder of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal. title: Aussie dollar rises to 16-month high against Japanese yen | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian dollar has had a strong year against the US greenback and Japanese yen.  It's partly because of expectations the Reserve Bank of Australia will lift interest rates in 2026 -- and the economic policies of Donald Trump and Sanae Takaichi, which have weakened their nations' currencies. title: Firefighters battle blazes as heatwave causes temperatures to soar across NSW | ABC NEWS
description: The New South Wales Rural Fire Service is fighting a fire near Newcastle over concerns it was going to impact nearby homes.  00:00 - Much of NSW has been under a high fire danger warning as parts of Sydney faced severe heatwave conditions with temperatures soaring above 40 degrees in the west.  02:03 - NSW RFS Commissioner Trent Curtin updates on expected fire conditions over the weekend. 03:14 - ABC Meteorologist Tom Saunders says it's one of the most severe heatwaves in years. title: Stage show tells the story of Australia's first Indigenous Olympian | ABC NEWS
description: Acclaimed artist Rhoda Roberts has returned to the Sydney Opera House for her one woman show, 'My Cousin Frank'. It tells the story of the first Aboriginal man to be selected to represent Australia at the 1964 Olympics - who had to travel on a British passport after being denied citizenship.  Rhoda has had a big impact on Australian cultural life and is credited with helping to introduce Welcomes to Country in the modern era.
